3 - Juggling obligations

## Topic 3 Top Words:
##       Highest Prob: children, tri, also, can, help, provid, spous 
##       FREX: children, help, overwhelm, newborn, tri, avail, spous 
##       Lift: convinc, sit, switch, weird, hypertens, de-stress, overwhelm 
##       Score: children, tri, help, can, also, spous, provid
## 
##  Topic 3: 
##       Trying to convince my In laws that this is not a hoax and they should be safe. Also trying to convince my husband we shouldn’t see them if they are not being safe.
##      Trying to work full-time and provide any sort of enriching learning environment for my children.
##      Continuing to work at home and have our children here has been the biggest struggle.  The inner conflict of neglecting my children because I have to be on a call or working and them not receiving the care they should be getting because I'm preoccupied with work (which wouldn't be a problem if they were at their schools). 
## 
## Our Montessori school is open and our children can attend during this time, but the concern of us (parents) strictly staying home and being quarantined, but then exposing our children to others does not sit well with me.  If we open our doors to allowing our children to be exposed, they could possibly bring something back to our family unknowingly.
##      We can not afford to pay rent. I was watching a couple children throughout the week to supplement income and I can no longer do that. I am a teacher, but the only one in our family with multiple degrees. My husband opted to work so I can stay home and homeschool our girls. I am also pregnant. I don’t know what we’re going to do. I also have concerns about my girls social-emotional development, especially at such a critical point not being able to be out in the environment with other children or people.
##      Trying to help them while trying to help myself

## 
##      Not being able to go on playdates with friends or just be out in public.  My child is a social butterfly and thrives on contact with people.  Without that, she becomes whiny, clingy, and grumpy.  I also benefit from having mom friends, but that hasn't happened either since the pandemic.

##  Topic 12: 
##       La situación financiera porque no hay ingresos desde el mes de Marzo. La situación emocional de los niños por estar encerrados casi todo el tiempo solo empezaron a salir hace un mes una vez por semana. El miedo al desalojo por falta de pago. Y las deudas que quedan por no pagar.
##      Mi esposo estuvo sin trabajo desde marzo 13 y regreso have 2 semanas. Nos mantuvimos con mi sueldo, pero yo no trabajo duramte el verano porque trabajo en una escuela. Ahora ya no recibo sueldo y el acaba de empezar, nos gastanos buena parte de los ahorros porque solo con mi sueldo no alcanzamos a pagar todos los servicios
##      Antes de que pasara esto del covid 19 mi hijo de 3 años tenía cita en la escuela para aber si lo aceptaban para el año 2020-2021 como niño de necesidades especiales. Esto a puesto en pausa todo y me preocupa todo lo que está pasando ya que mi hijo tiene problemas del corazón.
##      Queria que empesara el kinder y esta todo cerrado. Yo perdi mi trabajo grasias a la pandemia tengo 3 meses sin trabajo.  Tambien me preocupa que mi hijo se comporta agresivo por que no quiero sacarlo afuera a jugar pues temo k pueda infectarse afuera
##      Mi mayor preocupación ahora es el regreso ala escuela tengo mucho miedo que uno que niños se enfermen. Mucho más a mi hijo de 3 años que tuvo cirugía de corazón abierto y tiene condición de corazón.

21 - Fear about the unknown

## Topic 21 Top Words:
##       Highest Prob: will, like, look, happen, even, long, quarantin 
##       FREX: look, happen, situat, like, wave, will, affect 
##       Lift: american, pattern, prek, prolong, unclear, wave, happen 
##       Score: will, like, look, happen, even, long, situat
## 
##  Topic 21: 
##       My son has started to have some anxiety or fears and it’s troubling to me. For example, he was afraid of the bubbler at the pool where we have started swim lessons again. He cried during lessons and talked about the bubbler on and off for the next four days, even waking up in the morning talking about it. It’s hard to predict what he will be afraid of, and how long it will bother him
##      What the fall will look like. Both myself and my husband work for a school
## District. What will school look like? What will daycare look like? What will be safe?
##      I’m concerned that the USA will never be the same. It seems like fascism is winning while our country is sick with the pandemic and hurting from racial tensions caused by unforgivable police violence.
##      What will happen in September,if it will be a second wave of virus who will take care of my son while I am going to school or studying
##      Our housing problem started before covid but it definitely boiled into a whole bigger issue once this virus hit and even though I have extensive proof of everything that happened, no one, not the city I live in, not the court system in our city, council members in this area, I mean no one seems to care of this slumlord violates every right a tenant is supposed to have. I had eviction court last week and I wasn't even allowed in because i "had a fever of 102" yet i got home and took my temp three times on 2 different thermometers and I was under 98.6. So I literally wasn't allowed to defend myself, they refused to take or even look at any of our evidence, and they told us we had 30 days and were going to have another court date and then a magistrate made a ruling for my slumlord the next morning. I cannot even find a new place willing to work with us because people assume eviction makes me the trash in this situation but the truth is I almost lost my life in this property and my children have been hurt and even almost seriously hurt as well but this city doesn't seem to care. Not knowing if you'll be homeless while covid is still going around us literally terrifying and I can't believe we got our lives together and came so far to get totally screwed by some garbage person who values a meager amount of money over a family of 4 and their lives and mental and emotional health and I really can't believe no one seems to care either way.

1 - My husband’s responsibilities

## Topic 1 Top Words:
##       Highest Prob: husband, govern, got, dad, share, per, tanf 
##       FREX: husband, govern, got, hrs, share, solid, dad 
##       Lift: hrs, husband, promot, hustl, solid, rent-fre, dad 
##       Score: husband, govern, dad, got, per, share, tanf
## 
##  Topic 1: 
##       husband got a promotion with a salary bump (hence the move)
##      Sharing more responsibilities. Having my husband around more.
##      My husband and I are communicating about work schedules and sharing responsibility for the children is helpful.
##      my husband and I are able to share the responsibility of childcare due to flexible work schedules.
##      My husband got a job.

I naively never realized how truly little control I have over anything and how people “above” me can shut things down at a moments notice (even when medical reports being based off of are faulty and/or incomplete, but how serious decisions that affect millions and millions are made in knee jerk reaction) - realizing the power that government and organizations have, and how much us “little people” are considered nothing more than a potential contagion carrier, has been devastating to me. My extreme loneliness in all this has come not just from the physical distancing, but also the psychological distancing from each other. It’s been such a destruction to humanity. I deeply miss when we could see people as people, and not just as a collection of gross germs to avoid.
##      This has been a tremendous learning experience for us as we’ve learned to cope with one another being home all the time and practice a lot of patience!
##      This is the worst thing to experience.
##      It's been a learning experience. We have learned how to slow down and be okay with relaxing, while still keeping some kind of daily routine.

##  Topic 39: 
##       I say our income decreased but I was only substitute teaching so it wasn’t substantial. My husbands job hasn’t changed, he is simply working from home.
##      My daughter and I require pool therapy bi-weekly to control our chronic joint pain. Months going without this medical assistance has been excruciating.  But we're alive and not sick...so I cannot complain too much :)
##      We were very fortunate to keep our jobs and be able to work from home.
##      We are fortunate because we are able to still provide for ourselves unlike others that are not as fortunate.
##      Again, we recognize our privilege. Not only do we have the flexibility to work from home, but we have benefits such as paid sick leave and quality health insurance. Although my partner came to the U.S four years ago from South America, he has a green card so has not been impacted by the xenophobic and racist policies in the last few months.
##      Even with our large income, we pay for my in-laws house too, so we are stretched thin.  Trying to pay for childcare or a teacher if school closes may cost my entire salary.  Then do I quit?  Take Fmla?
##      There has definitely been some challenges but we are in a fortunate position that our income hasn’t been affected and our childcare needs can be met as I’m still on maternity leave.
##      It's hard to keep a toddler at home specially because we used to go to the park everyday . We walked  around the neighborhood.  It was hard for him to stay inside at the beginning now he is watching more TV than the usual.  Our income decreased dramatically my husband lost his job and I decided to stop working . I didn't want to be exposed to the Virus and that was  probably the best decision for our family even though we knew it was going to be hard to survive. Better be safe than sorry.
##      It fortunately hasn’t had a huge impact on my family.
